thread.title: Denver man accused of fatally shooting transit officer
thread.title_full: Denver man accused of fatally shooting transit officer

author: CHRISTOPHER BRENNAN
title: Denver man accused of fatally shooting transit officer
text:
Denver man accused of 'unprovoked' fatal shooting of transit officer Denver man accused of fatally shooting transit officer A makeshift memorial put up by Denver Police for transit officer Scott Von Lanken. (David Zalubowski/AP) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Updated:   7:12 PM 
A Denver man is accused of fatally shooting a transit security officer and former pastor in an "unprovoked" attack. 
Scott Von Lanken, 56, was talking to two women near a downtown train station late Tuesday when he a gunman held a gun to his neck and then fired, according to police. 
Joshua Cummings was arrested shortly after the attack at a nearby apartment building’s patio, and officers said they found a 9mm handgun. 
It was not immediately clear what would lead the 37-year-old to kill the officer for Denver area’s public transportation system, and authorities called the shooting a random attack. 
Colorado considers ending switchblade knife ban 
Denver Police Cmdr. Barb Archer said that Von Lanken may have been targeted because of his uniform. 
Von Lanken, mourned by both the city's transportation authority and the contractor he worked for on Wednesday, had also previously worked as an evangelical preacher. Scott Von Lanken worked as both a security officer and a pastor. (Facebook) 
Two women who were receiving directions from the officer said that a man with a swollen face and “weird looking eyes” told Von Lanken something to the effect of “do what you are told” before the shooting. 
Cummings is a Texas native who owned a Jiu-Jitsu academy there, KCNC reported. 
The station cited sources saying that he was found with "Muslim documents," though it was not immediately clear what they contained. 
This is a developing story and will be updated Join the Conversation:
